title: Quiz 1 - Statement Assumption
instruction: Directions: A statement is given followed by several assumptions. An assumption is something assumed or taken for granted. Read the statement carefully and decide which of the assumptions are implicit in the statement.

quiz.text: Statement: “There is so much noise out here. How can a sincere student study here?” – a mother of a student tells her husband. Assumptions: I. Noise is not very conducive to children. II. Noise may hamper study. III. The mother cares for her child’s health.
options: Only II is implicit
I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
Only III is implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “A majority of our population is still suspicious of our stock markets. We need to have greater transparency in trading.” – a stockbroker. Assumptions: I. Greater transparency in trading is a desirable feature of the stock markets. II. Stock market operations are not transparent these days. III. Lack of adequate transparency is one of the main reasons behind people’s suspicion of our stock markets.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
II and II are implicit
I and II are implicit
I and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Nokia introduces the world’s easiest-to-use cellular phone. Small in size, huge in performance.” – an advertisementAssumptions: I. People want convenience while using a cellular phone.II. People want small-sized cellular phones.III. Cellular phones were not available before.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
I and II are implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “The Samba spying case has blown away the myth that the Indian army is disciplined and impartial.” – an editorialAssumptions: I. Samba is the name of the file that was smuggled to another country.II. It was believed that Indian army is disciplined.III. Spying scandals are not welcome in an army.
options: Only II is implicit
I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
Only III is implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Hungry stomachs do not understand high values and economic ethics. They will vote a man who gives them rice.” – A political analyst on why a particular party won the election. Assumptions: I. A lot of people are hungry. II. Rice was not available previously. III. Rice was available only in limited quantity.
options: Only I is implicit
I and II are implicit
I and III are implicit
Either II or III is implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “If obscene songs have become popular, the masses are responsible for it. Why do they listen to these songs or buy these cassettes?” – A writer in his speech on today’s society.Assumptions: I. Buying cassettes of a song is an indication of its popularity.II. Obscene songs were not recorded earlier.III. The masses have no taste for good music.
options: Only I is implicit
I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
Can’t say

quiz.text: Statement: “To err is human. Every man makes mistakes. But to learn from those mistakes is what makes men great. And this is why there are so few of great men around us.” – A philosopher in his speech.Assumptions: I. Mistakes do not make significant issue.II. There are very few persons who learn from mistakes.III. If a man learns from mistakes, he is a great man.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
I and II are implicit
I, II and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Corruption needs to be fought at all costs. We are paying a heavy price for corruption.” – A minister in his speech.Assumptions: I. The minister is not corrupt.II. There exists corruption in our system.III. Politicians suffer the most as a result of corruption.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
I, II and III are implicit
Only II is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “The success of a film does not change me or my behaviour. Why should it? I don’t think I have become arrogant after Baazigar’s success.” – Shah Rukh Khan in an interview. Assumptions: I. Some star do change after a successful film. II. Baazigar is a successful film. III. There is no reason why a star should change after a successful film.
options: Only I is Implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
only I and II are implicit
Only I and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “We cannot prevent the shock waves but we do compensate for them. Insure with Oriental Insurance – the company that offers most comprehensive insurance against earthquakes.” – an advertisement Assumptions: I. Earthquakes carry shock waves with them. II. Orient Insurance is not the only company that insures against earthquakes. III. Earthquakes are natural phenomena.
options: I and II are implicit
I and III are implicit
II and III are implicit
Only I is implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Please do not preach us non-violence. It was not your wife they raped. It was not your son they killed.” – A group of irate Sikhs to Gandhi in 1947. Assumptions: I. People wanted to use violence. II. In 1947, some women were raped. III. The pain of a tragedy is the greatest when it happens to one’s own folks.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
III and I are implicit
All are implicit
Only III is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Yes, it was my wife, it was my son. Because your women are my women and your sons, my sons. And still, I shall preach non-violence.” – Gandhi replying to the same mob.Assumptions: I. Gandhi believed that non-violence is the best answer to all conflicts.II. Gandhi did suffer in the suffering of the Sikhs.III. People could be transformed by showing to them the rational way.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “The tickets have been sold out. Poor fellow, he came all the way from Maya Nagar and now, he has to return disappointed.” – A man about a stranger outside a cinema hall.Assumptions: I. Maya Nagar is far off from the cinema hall.II. The man himself got his tickets.III. The movie is a super hit.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
I and II are implicit
I and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “A short man was seen around the shop at seven o’clock. This does not mean that he was Khashogi. Khashogi is five feet eight inch.” – A lawyer in the court. Assumptions: I. Khashogi is the man whom the lawyer is defending. II. There is truth in the statement that a short man was seen around the shop at seven. III. Five-feet-eight-inch-tall men are not ‘short’.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
All are implicit
Only I is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Nathuram Godse was prepared to kill anybody who came between him and his dream of a ‘Hindu Rashtra’. He had his reasons to kill Gandhiji.” – a book of historyAssumptions: I. The author knows the character of Nathuram Godse well.II. Godse thought that Gandhiji was an obstruction in the way to a ‘Hindu Rashtra’.III. Godse might be a fanatic but he was not irrational.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
I and II are implicit
All are implicit
II and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “The Bombay Stock Exchange Index has collapsed. Perhaps the brokers were panicked at rumors of the finance minister’s resignation.” – a newspaper report. Assumptions: I. The cause of the collapse is not definitely known. II. The finance minister is important in the eyes of the brokers. III. The rumors of the finance minister’s resignation were baseless.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “The prices should fall after May. By that time the demand of foodgrains starts dropping.” – an economist Assumptions: I. Price will not fall before May. II. The economist is in link with farmers of the country. III. A drop in demand (of foodgrains) will show drop in supply (of foodgrains).
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
II and III are implicit
None is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “I think that she has gone mad. Last night, I saw her barking like a dog.” – A tells B about Madhu.Assumptions: I. Madhu is a friend of A.II. B knowns Madhu.III. Some people do not bark like dogs.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
All are implicit
Either I or II and III are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Do not touch stray objects. They may be bombs.” – a notice by the City Police.Assumptions: I. Stray objects are harmless.II. Stray objects may be touched by people.III. People will take notice of the warning.
options: I and II are implicit
I and III are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and either II or III are implicit
At least one of the above is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Clearly, the judiciary cannot provide all answer. But it seems the public, weary of an inactive executive, is turning to the Supreme Court as a last resort.” – an article.Assumptions: I. The Supreme Court is above the executive.II. The Supreme Court is more active than the executive.III. The executive does not have sufficient powers.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “People of all castes, religion and locality were swayed. Who can deny the power of a good orator?” – an excerpt from a politician’s diary.Assumptions: I. A speech was made by the politician.II. The politician does not believe in caste.III. Only powerful oratory has the power to transcend the barrier of caste and religion.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
Only III is implicit
All are implicit
None are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “the involvement of our senior scientists in the ISRO case is really shocking. It is regrettable that they put money before national interest.” – an editorialAssumptions: I. The ISRO case involves the active hand of our scientists in supplying secret documents to another country.II. Our scientists were not expected to do such a thing.III. National interest should command a higher priority than money.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
All are implicit
Only III is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Persons with strong political connections are being posted as judge. It is no surprise that the judiciary is coming in the shadow of corruption.” – A person in a debate.Assumptions: I. A person with strong political connections is likely to be corrupt.II. A person with strong political connections may or may not be corrupt.III. Politics and judiciary have hopelessly mingled these days.
options: Only I is implicit
Only II is implicit
I and III are implicit
Either I or II is implicit
All are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “I don’t care if the world calls me conservative. But my wife won’t work in films after she marries me.” – An actor in an interview. Assumptions: I. The actor is not much bothered about what the world think of him. II. The actor is unmarried. III. Not allowing the wife to work in films may be taken as a sign of conservatism.
options: I and II are implicit
II and III are implicit
I and III are implicit
All are implicit
Only II is implicit

quiz.text: Statement: “Why should we not protest? When we ask for drinking water they give us Pepsi and Coca-Cola.” – A politician in an interview.Assumptions: I. Only drinking water is good for people’s health.II. Providing people with drinking water is more important than providing Pepsi and Coca-Cola.III. Pepsi and Coca-Cola do not contain healthy drinking water.
options: I and II are implicit
Only I is implicit
II and III are implicit
Only II is implicit
Either II or III is implicit
